wear out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to become damaged and useless, or to make something like this, by using it a lot or for a long time
wear out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: My boots are beginning to wear out.
He travels so much he actually wears out suitcases.
wear out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to make someone feel extremely tired
wear out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: All this shopping has worn us out.
Illness and death came suddenly; over the years she had simply worn herself out.
wear out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to stay with someone longer than they want you to
